text: Glad  they finally have a location near me . The food is incredibly fresh and great tasting . The BEST gyros in Las Vegas hands down . Prices are very fare when compared . The owner and staff really do care. A must try .

Let's just say I could be in trouble as this place is basically right across the street from my house.  So I might be spending a lot more time there soon.  

Went there for the first time today for lunch.  I had the chicken souvlaki plate which came with either french fries or rice, Greek salad, Tzatziki sauce and pita bread.  I choose the french fries for my plate.  I love it that I have choices on what sides I want on my plate.  

It came with 2 skewers of chicken with like 6 pieces on each. The chicken tasted great and was cooked prefect.  The side Greek salad was real fresh with plenty of veggies and tasted real good.  The french fries were cooked prefect crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The Tzatziki sauce was fantastic almost as good as my mom's.  The pita bread came out nice and warm and tasted good too.  I asked for extra onions on my salad and on the side which they gladly gave me no extra charge.  The plate cost $12.95 so price was not too expensive for all the food you get.  There was plenty of condiments, napkins and etc on the counter and on the tables. It was enough food to keep me full all day.

The guy that took my order was real nice and answered all my questions.  The food came out pretty quickly and looked nice.  The place was real clean plenty of different seating areas.  I will be back for sure as a matter of fact thinking about going there for lunch tomorrow already.

I thought the flavors were great the food was very fresh and homemade the Falafel was moist and tasty smooth and not gritty I was very happy and impressed to eat here the only downside I would say what's the price a little on the expensive side for what kind of food you get that's still relatively worth it

Food is great but the service sucks! I ordered two items for to-go during lunch time. A party of 7 people came after me and they got their food first. I ordered the same thing. When I approached the cashier/waiter/busser, the bald guy, he gave me an attitude. I asked what was taking long and his remark was (it's only been 18 minutes). The cooks heard him and looked at me from the window. The other lady worker apologized. I wanted to ask the bald guy how long his lunch break was and if he could scarf down the food in 12 minutes. 

Update: I went back 8/3/17 and the service was amazing and dinner was awesome. Will be back :)

Writing this as I wait for my son to finish up his meal here. I couldn't leave without making sure to say just how fantastic this place is! The menu has a nice variety and makes it easy for vegetarians & vegans with little symbols on their items. Staff were all friendly and knowledgeable. The restaurant is clean & tidy and they have plenty of seating, including an outdoor patio. Our table tried the Greek salad, a falafel pita,the mezze plate (enough for two to share or one as a meal if you want to try a bit of everything vegetarian) and the baklava. We had zero complaints and will definitely be back!

i am a huge fan of mediterranean food.... this place is amazing...great food, super nice staff and great pricing.
sorry crazy pita....you lost me to the great greek mediterranean  grill!

This is my favorite Greek  place in Vegas ...100% for food and really good  service. I visited 2 stores Henderson and then new one the same food ...The new one is bigger and more tables and outdoor sits .
Love this place! Great service and great food! Been im here twice in less than 24 hrs.

Amazing. From the moment you walk in the decor is fresh and slightly urban with an incredibly inviting.  The staff is super polite and helpful.  The food is fantastic. Two can split many of the entrees.   I can't wait to return!

My parents are always ordering take out from here on a weekly basis so when I am in town visiting we always stop and grab their Greek Salad which is the best Greek salad I've had.  So good that I had it twice in one week and I almost went here today again lol.  

I can't speak on their other dishes but since my parents are always coming here and order more than just the salad I have to believe that this spot is good!
Love the selection of their foods... their meat is not dry (compare to the other stores) ,all the sides are goid as well... love the interior design as well...

Fresh delicious Mediterranean food. Try the classic Greek salad with the add-on chicken or salmon skewer. 

Well designed eating area. Outdoor seating also available. 

We really needed a good quick easy restaurant choice on this side of town. Right in Blue Diamond. 

It truly is great!

Authentic Greek food that tastes amazing! We have yet to dine in here but do call in for takeout. Have not had a bad thing yet. But true to most Greek places you'll be sure to find your salad on top of all of the hot things in your take out bag. That and the price is a little high is the reason for four out of five. You just have to ask them to bag your salad separate. Love that there is a good Greek place on the south west side of town now.
Falafel pita was delicious!  Great service even though place was packed.  Love their order online option - easy to use.  Will return and recommend for sure.

My absolute go to! These guys are so friendly and the food is delish. The four dips with pita are everything. Their rice pudding is one of the best I've ever had (don't tell my Mom). I've yet to try a dish that doesn't meet or surpass my expectations. Keep doing what you're doing! You guys are awesome.  P.S. Sergio from EBC says 'Hi'! :)

This place is AWESOME!!  I have been waiting for good Greek food to come to the Southwest and it is finally here.  The food is the freshest in Las Vegas.  I had the Great Greek Gyro and it was packed with flavorful beef/lamb meat.  It is clear that they make their own tzatziki sauce because it was just so fresh and tasty.  The cashier talked me into the feta fries and I will be indebted to her forever.  They are a must get every time.  My wife had a salad with a chicken skewer.  She hasn't stopped talking about it.  The veggies were so fresh and the chicken was tender and had great flavor.  Do yourself a favor and save some room for dessert.  The rice pudding and baklava ice cream are both outstanding.  

The restaurant is clean and the decor is very tasteful. 

The staff is super friendly and helpful and I just absolutely love this place.

Thanks Great Greek for making this my new favorite restaurant.

Visited recently due to my go to place being closed on Monday's. Was a little smaller than anticipated but was it was packed. Food was good, service was robotic and some items didn't come out (newer operation completely understand). Would visit again, but didn't take the number one place on my list of go tos.

The restaurant was clean with a nice atmosphere. Staff was friendly and the service was fast.  Ordered the Great Greek gyro which was delicious.  Only downfall was it was a little pricey. We usually go to the Greek Bistro in Henderson for our favorite Greek food but this is a close second.
Today I'm having the Greek salad with a side of hummus it was good the gyro was better and the service was good
Delicious and fresh . The staff is super friendly and helpful . Best gyros in LV hands down . Come get one SUCKA !!!

I love, love, love this place!!!!  This is the hardest working restaurant family helping you get your Great Greek on!!! 
I promise you, they will not disappoint!!!!  
      They are energetic and passionate about their heritage. They certainly show you why the family comes together around food!

Delicious food, quick service. What more could you want from a fast-food Greek restaurant? My only complaint is that it can be incredibly crowded during busy hours (good for them, bad for people looking for a seat). There is outdoor seating available, but it's way to cold to do that this time of year.

I'm a huge fan of The Great Greek! It's been so fantastic having a new SW location that's just as great as the Henderson location. The food is always fresh and delicious.. amazing customer service as well!! Thank you Great Greek team!

Awesome, casual eatery in a modern and bright environment. The food is tasty but not at all greasy. Great portions and fast and friendly service. The gyro platter is great, but the lamb souvlaki takes the medal. Platters are served with a small salad before the entree. They are prompt with take-out orders as well. The price point is amazing! Definitely two thumbs up from me.
Love this new place. The food and service was great and the venue is tastefully decorated. Cheap and cheerful.
Place is awesome. Great food. The ice T is good. Close by. Nice employees,fair pricing never a long wait.

Never been to the Henderson location but was ecstatic to find out this new location was opening close to home! Very welcoming and attentive staff, ambiance is very clean and modern with a straightforward menu. I love that it's not a fancy sit down, just order at the cashier, and yet you shall be served! Will most def be coming back as I love Greek food! The guy at the counter was totally right, Baklava ice cream is to die for!
Food was great as usual, make sure and try the "Great Greek Gyro, and the grape leaves!!!!! Boom!!!!!

Too Expansive for a casual dining fast food restaurant.  We ordered gyro sandwich and chicken kabob plate and gyro was excessively covered with white sauce....can't taste the meat , gross! My husband's dish was nothing to wow about ether, just an average place . Will not return.

I'm so glad The Great Greek moved to this new location. I was initially worried that the food might be different or not as good here but I'm so glad they've kept the integrity of the food as the original location. The salmon Great Greek rice bowl along with the hummus and pita is everything your taste buds needs and more.

The service was incredible and friendly!  The food was so fresh and authentic!  DEFINITELY my new go to for Greek food! Perfect portions! Such great vibes as well!  Loved the decor and cleanliness.  I will be back :)

Amazing Greek food.   I'm so glad this opened so close to where I live.   I've had the Great Greek Gyro, dolamades, and feta fries over the last few visits.  I've had nothing less than fast, fresh, and delicious.   Great job to everyone on staff.   Can't wait to stop by again.

Came here based on their good reviews and the convenient location. However, I didn't have the same experience. I came with the expectations of another similar Greek restaurant. I love the grilled chicken/shrimp Greek salad from the restaurant I usually go to so of course I had to try it here. The chicken skewer here was extremely dry, no flavor to them at all, almost like they were over cooked. The salad was alright, lettuce was extremely huge so I had to cut them down with a knife to eat them comfortably. Overall I just wasn't too impressed with the salad that I love so dearly at the other restaurant. Perhaps maybe I'll try their other meat options next time if I ever decide to come back. 

They were very busy during dinner time so maybe I might've just had a bad batch of chicken that night.

Poor service, forgot item in to go order. Manager confirmed everything was there. Had to go back to get missing item. Asked for free small side of hummus for having to drive back and get the item they forgot. They refused and wanted to charge me for a small side. Very surprised for the inconvenience and lack of wanting to make up for their mistake. Not the best way to start out in a new area.

Wifey and I were craving some gyros. Our typical spot is all the way in Henderson so we decided to check this place out. The place is clean with nice decorations and overall inviting atmosphere. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. I gave it a 3 stars based only on their gyros. To me it lack flavor and that certain "umph", it does not beat our favorite spot but it's not the worst either. Fries were nothing special but the feta fries was something worth getting. Wifey also enjoyed their Baklava dessert. Would come back but definitely nothing I would be dying to go for.

I'm a fan of Greek food and this place is no joke, one of the best in Vegas. The food is fresh, amazing flavors, and portions are sizeable. Great value and the service is excellent. I had my first visit last week and it was so good that I brought others and ended up eating there three times in one week. Got to try the feta cheese fries, they are out of this world. Give it a try, I bet you can't stay away.

Came in to take some lunch to go. Walking in the restaurant was full of people and clean, always a good sign. The workers were super nice and accommodating! I ordered the great greek gyro with feta fries and hummus as an appetizer. Everything was delicious! I have had gyros all around the city and this is by far the best. Definitely worth taking a visit to the Great Greek Grill. Keep it up! :)

The Great Greek has the best gyro that I have eaten here in Vegas!  It was so flavorful and they do not skimp on the meat!  The pita bread was perfect, as well!  The pita was soft but sturdy enough to hold the ingredients well.  

My husband and I shared an order of feta fries.  The feta fries were amazing!  The fries were crisp and flavorful. The feta cheese topping was so flavorful and melted to perfection.  It was a generous amount and was perfect to share with our gyros.  

This restaurant is a must for great gyros!  We will definitely go back soon!  The reason I only gave four stars is because of the dining area.  The dining area was not that special.  If the dining area had nicer tables and chairs and a more pleasant atmosphere/ambiance with actual waiter service and wine and beer it would actually be pretty perfect.  

I will say the employees were nice, especially the man that took the order at the counter.  He was very helpful!

My husband and I regularly order food from here. It is very tasty and usually SO good. We just ordered our usual items and the hummus appetizer was very runny. Normally the taste and consistency is spot on. It was rather disappointing this time, hence only 4
Stars being given.
Pretty good Greek fast food.   Gyros plate was plentiful yet undercooked but order came out fast. Nice side salad with it. If you  are unlucky to sit on counter you get to look at the wall

The Great Greek is amazing. They never disappoint! The food always tastes fresh and delicious and they are very consistent about it. I always order the small salad (more than enough for 1 person) with a skewer of some kind (chicken or beef, both always so tender and juicy). Their garlic feta fries are also a must-have every time. 

I've probably eaten there 10 times and I still have yet to explore the rest of their menu, but I'm confident it's all good!

The SW is blessed to have this restaurant in the area.

My wife and I have been here a few times.  Every time we have had good food and service.  Restaurant is new so it's very clean.  I have called my order in a couple times and each time It has been ready and waiting at the counter when I showed up.  Order was always correct.  Glad to have a good greek place closer to home.

Greeeeeeat Greek food in the city. At first, I was a bit concerned about the food not being as good as the Henderson location. The food was consistent!!! This makes me very happy, as this location is closer to my house. Very very fresh food, great flavor and excellent service. Try the chicken rice bowl. It's amazing! And, always order hummus ;-)

The food was delicious and good service. It's fast food, you put your order in. And they bring it to the table. After dinner we ordered the rice pudding, but we're all out. Next time I'll order the ice pudding with my food, we got cookies instead they were delicious.
Awesome food.  Good price and their not stingy on the amount of food they give you.  People working there are friendly and courteous.

Seriously this place is the greatest! Food is always hot, fresh, totally tasty and practically melts in your mouth! Service is always good and everyone is friendly. If it is busy, it is always worth the wait. My favorite Greek place in town!

Picked up lunch to go today and everything was perfect. We had the Traditional gyro combo with fries, the gyro was HUGE and flavorful, the fries were seasoned and crispy. We also had the beef skewers with rice pilaf and salad, again generous portions, well cooked and flavorful. The staff was very friendly, the food was ready in the 10 minutes they quoted on the phone, and the order was accurate. 
I will be back soon, and often! I'm so happy to have some delicious Greek food near home.

This place is deliciously fresh and tasty. Love the look of the inside. So cute. The food was so fresh tasting. My husband and I shared a gyro meat plate, I also had the chicken lemon soup. It was all so delicious. I usually don't like tiziki sauce (that I've tried at another Greek place down the street) but theirs was so yummy and fresh. I literally could put it on everything. I highly recommend this place and am beyond happy it's right down the street!! :)
So good! Very clean place, food is fresh, healthy, and meat is tender. Absolutely love it!
Delicious! We came in for dinner and I can say the food is phenomenal! Big portion and u can tell the food is fresh!

The Great Greek is really GREAT. One of the best gyros I have ever had. And it is right by my house. I've been there 3 times and the gyro is soo good I haven't ordered anything else! Definitely check this place out.

Such a great spot! Wish I had discovered it sooner. Excellent food, very friendly service and reasonable prices. It does get a little crowded around lunchtime, but that's only because it's a great option for a quick, great meal. Lemon soup is delicious! I recommend you try it! Family meals are I really good value and both have great choices. Definitely feeds more than you'd think.

Ate here for the 2nd time today and boy was it still a disappointment. First time we came here, I ordered a falafel pita and was disappointed by what I got. Instead of getting light and fluffy on the inside, crunchy on the outside falafels, I got mushy falafels that were falling apart. I didn't think too much of it and attributed it to probably a bad batch. Came again today thinking it might be different, but what I got were still the same mushy, soggy, broken down falafels. They didn't even hold their shape when I got them! It would have been okay if it still had that crispy exterior, but even that was non-existent. To top it all off, we waited for my hubby's Greek salad with chicken for more than 15 minutes, while other people, who ordered the same thing after us, got theirs first. He finally went up to the lady to ask why it was taking so long, and lo and behold, his order was just sitting there on the counter. By the time we got his order, the chicken was no longer hot-- heck it wasn't even warm to say the least. We gave them a second chance, and were still sadly let down. Guess were sticking to Meraki's!
Says they're open till 9pm, closed at 7pm. Please fix your hours on yelp and your website and your door. What a waste of a fresh new spot in southern highlands.

So glad there is a Greek place near me now! The decor is really pretty! Bright and clean, tons of tables and seating options, tables and chairs were clean modern looking. 

I got the Gyro plate which was really good. Meat was not too salty, fries were crunchy, salad was fresh, sauces were delicious. My brother got the garlic shrimp and loved it, the rice smelled amazing and tasted great. I like that their plates and silverware looked nicer than you would expect it to, not paper plates or cheap looking plasticware. This is great for pictures :) 

First experience here was great, will definitely come back to try other dishes.

I really loved how great this food tasted, and I appreciated how nice and clean the aesthetic was. My coworker and I, along with a lot of other customers, were just there for take-out, and while the wait was a little long, there was also a HUGE line of people - this place is really getting some business. The prices were a little high, so I wouldn't visit here too often, but the portion sizes were large to make up for that. I really can't stress how fresh and tasty everything was. I highly recommend checking this place out!

Staff very friendly and nice. We wanted to change it up from the traditional burger place and I'm glad we did. I ended up getting the rice bowl which definitely hit the spot after traveling all day and eating nothing.
This place is so tasty! The Greek salad with steak skewers is my go to for my ketogenic way of eating. The portions are generous too!

Very good quality food... I tried the lamb souvlaki and is delicious 
And very friendly staff 
I recommend

We were there last week for TISE. Found this place on the way back to LA, the place is very clean and bright. The service is excellent.

The food is really good and so is the quality. We will definitely go back again.

Excellent food, I always have to stop by when I'm in the area. I love their gyros because they definitely don't skimp on the meat. And it isn't overly salty like many Greek/Mediterranean places I've been to. You also have to try the baklava... Amazing!

This is the go place if you are around Henderson 
Amazing! The food is fresh and healthy! I love the salmon bowl. It's packed with greens carbs and protein.

First time trying it here didn't know what to expect, I  ordered the Greek salad with shrimp and chicken it was greasy and delicious... nice helpful staff as well.. definitely coming back soon to eat more authentic Greek cuisine
Awesome Greek food and super nice staff. I am afraid there is nothing more to say!  Loved it!!

Staff is friendly and helpful. The food is fresh. My boyfriend and I enjoyed the classic gyro. The only thing I will do differently next time is ask for the Taki sauce on the side. It was a bit heavy and I scraped some of it off, but the food still tasted great. We will definitely be back!

Food is fresh and delicious!!!
Very clean and nice inside
Has a nice outside seating area too
Reasonably priced
The chicken skewers were my fav!
Great place for a quick healthy lunch

I was THRILLED...that The Great Greek opened a restaurant in the Southwest area of the valley. I have previously eaten at their Henderson location - quite frequently and loved it. For a brand new restaurant, you would have no idea, because the team that is in place there knows what they are doing. They offer fast, friendly and accurate customer service. There is no different in the food from location to location - at least that I am able to tell anyway. 

From this restaurant, I've had the Grilled Garlic Shrimp and the Grilled Steak Souvlaki with Feta Fries - Both were excellent and will satisfy any craving that you're having, especially the Feta Fries. In terms of desert the Baklava is the best that I've ever had. A few weeks ago, I took a friend from Oklahoma here while he was in town and he described the Baklava as "being the best he's ever had outside of Greece." 

There is good seating indoor and outdoor. With long lines it can get a little tight, but that's just part of living in a city like Las Vegas. The restaurant does to-go orders, but you have to place the order in the store. Once this location is able to handle online orders I will be more apt to grab dinner. This reason, and because they ran out of rice at 8:30pm on a Tuesday night (it was close to closing time) is the reason for a four star rating. Once the online thing is up and running, five stars!
Excellent food, good prices and great customer service.  I will be making this a regular stop
This place is awesome. Husband had a lamb gyro and I had a steak rice bowl. It was so good! You should try this place.

This is our favorite Friday night date night dinner spot. Service is awesome!  Staff very friendly and helpful. Food is so out of this world GREAT. I switch up between the lamb skewers and the gyro. Stacy has the beef skewers as a rule. The salads are awesome. Just a little heavy on the onion. You must try them if you like real Greek food.
First time here and loved everything about this place. From the food to the friendly customer service! Baklava tasted like God made it himself. I will definitely be coming back!

I was spoiled on retro row in long beach with 3 amazing Greek places all with different flavors and menus. This place is one of two that have spicy feta here in town and this spot makes it the best! The Avegalemno soup is so-so but they are against my old favorite place in SoCal. However, the rice pilaf perfect. This is my new go to dinner spot. Eat Fresh / Eat Greek ! id give 10 stars if I could.

OMG!!!!!!!! The best!  Everything is amazing, but the feta fries with Taziki!!!!!! Holy buckets, who knew I could be a vegetarian and just eat that the rest of my life!!!  Hummus and lamb the best I have ever had!

Upon walking into this restaurant, the ambiance is inviting. The decor is the typical blue and white from the Greece flag. I ordered the great Greek gyro (chicken) with tzatziki sauce on the side. Made it a combo with feta fries and a drink - everything was delicious!!!! Fresh, flavorful, and exactly as specified on the menu! Can't wait to go back and try more!

First time here, my husband went yesterday . We both got the Lamb great Greek gyros... they are huge and delicious. We also got fries and the butter cookies which are also really good ! We will be back

This is my favorite Greek place in town, it's just a bit pricey I feel. The food is really good and quality is as well. However, three meals and drinks, with tip was $60. That's why they get four instead of five stars. I'd be here all the time if it were less expensive. 

I've never had anything bad or disappointing here, and the kids like it. Even the picky one likes it because it's simple. We usually get chicken or steak souvlaki when we are there, and it's offered with fries or rice pilaf not also comes with a really good side Greek salad. The kids plates aren't quiet half price and come with one skewer instead of two. I order the full size and they split it. 

Yesterday they were offering a special of mousakka (sp) and it was really good. It's egg plant, ground beef, potatoes and bechamel sauce  it also came with the side salad. 

I recommend the feta fries, falafels, hummus with pita, cookies and baklava as well. We don't always get those but they never disappoint. 

I like that they have healthy options that are just part of the regular menu, because you really can't go wrong with a protein and salad.
Outstanding food, fresh and tasty and authentic. The staff is great, really a comfortable atmosphere with great food.

A-mazing!!  So Delicious.  I want to come back again tomorrow.
Fresh ingredients, super clean, well decorated, all around great atmosphere.  The employees were super friendly as well.
Fast, casual, clean, and super fresh greek food. Love this place. Salads with a meat add-on and the lemon soup are my favorite but everything's great. Friendly and efficient staff. Good location

My favorite greek spot down the street & around the corner from my house! I absolutely love the avgolemono soup I wish it came in a bigger size. I get the rice pilaf side & chicken skewer at least 3 times a week & that's enough for me as a meal & a snack for work later on. Always on time with my pickup.

Discovered this gem on a drive by. Authentic Greek food made with love. My daughter had the falafel gyro and I had the lamb/beef gyro. Both were wonderfully delicious. I also had a small salad and she had fries. The salad was fresh and delicious with romaine, feta, kalamata olives, and most importantly, the tomatoes were fresh and crispy. The fries were crispy and flavorful too. I highly recommend this business. You won't be disappointed!

Its great to have a new cuisine in the area off Blue Diamond, if you are in the area you know the choices aren't vast. With that said The Great Greek Mediterranean Grill in my opinion is not the greatest Greek you can get in town. Meraki Greek Grill or Shish Kabob House is a much fresher choice for the same value. I found the Grilled Chicken Souvlaki plate ($14.02 w/tax) at the Great Greek to be dry and mildly flavorful. The rice pilaf was cooked properly and probably my favorite part of the dish. The feta on the salad was fresh as well as the other ingredients, olive garden should ask for their vinaigrette recipe its pretty dang good! So I would have to give their salad an A+. I would cover dessert but when I was in line ordering I asked if I could get a order of Baklava but I was informed they where out (this was at about 8:15 pm they close at 9 pm). A customer behind me, which ordered (5) orders of baklava ice cream told me that the baklava dessert was awesome, sad to say I didn't get to try it. That actually might get me to go back on another night when I want a quick and easy fix for some Greek food, that and the salad. Other than that I am traveling to Meraki off Trop and rainbow. The Great Greek does stay open a little later than others so that is another plus and actually the reason I tried them in the first place, as Meraki closes at 8:30 pm. the owner was there the night I came in, great operator, friendly staff, clean establishment. I want to give this establishment a higher rating but the food was just not there for me.

Food is good but service has been slipping over the last year.  Last two time have have gone they took forever to bring my main course out after I got salad.  Second time brought out main dish and forgot to bring out salad first.  Then had to wait for utensils to eat while my salmon got cool.  Not good.

Came back today with my wife. She go the falafel Gyros and love it.  I got my traditional Gyros. It tasted even better the second time around. Bread was soft and meat and veg were super fresh. I ask for some extra peppers. Girl that work there more than happy to give us some. Great service and food. This is our go to place for greek food. :)

First time here for lunch on 5/27/18. Great food, everything tasted very fresh. Even the soda was good! I will say that the feta fries are great! I couldn't eat them fast enough! Next time I plan on having them with the lamb/beef gyro meat. Very clean inside & a bright room. I will definitely be back! Thank you for a tasty lunch!

My favorite place! I just had the chicken gyro twice this week along with the feta fries that are so amazing. Delicious fries with melted feta cheese. This place has seriously never failed me. Both locations are great which is a plus because sometimes different locations are not consistent. I definitely recommend this if you want Greek food.

This place is a 10min walk from my house and I absolutely love it!!! We don't have a lot of good food in our area and The Great Greek was such a breath of fresh air! Not only was it one of the only food places I could eat while pregnant(everything made me super sick) but my daughter is 6months and I still crave this place. Iv never been given bad food. Service is always fast and AMAZING.

Simple fresh ingredients! I love good Greek food and The Great Greek is just that - great! Came here on a Monday afternoon for lunch and the place was pretty busy. I ordered the Greek salad as a wrap. The dish was simple yet the flavor was amazing and the lettuce seemed very fresh. We also enjoyed the feta fries - you can never go wrong with cheese and fries! 

My friend got the combination plate with lamb and steak and said the meat was excellent. I would return to the Great Greek and recommend it for a quick healthy lunch!

I have been a customer of The Great Greek located in Henderson for quite some time. So, when I saw the sign go up that they were building a Great Greek near me I was pretty excited to say the least. My to go meal is the greek salad with gyro meat. It's always so fresh and crisp! I have tried several greek salads around town and the Great Greek remains my favorite! I recently tried their chicken skewer plate and it was delicious as well! I have noticed it's quite busy at this location as well, but worth the wait!

We went to the location in Henderson the day prior. Had we not have gone there first, this would have been 5 stars. The food was still outstanding 
-Feta dip w cucumbers 
-Greek salad with gyro meat
-Greek bowl with double chicken 

The service was ok....... nothing great nothing bad. But after the over the top great service at the Henderson location, this location was more get you in and out and boarder line rushed you with ordering and picking up your order. Again, still a great experience, just not on the same level as Henderson!

See you tomorrow, LOL!
I order the Greek salad with chicken/shrimp skewers. It was so fresh and so satisfying! Will definitely be back! Place was nice and clean. The staff was friendly.

Food is absolutely amazing! We ordered through Postmates and were not disappointed. So glad we have a quality Greek restaurant in the area to keep coming back to. I highly recommend the Greek salad and beef and lamb gyro. So fresh and perfectly seasoned and made with pride. We will be back. Thanks!

Best Greek in town IMO. Our family's typical order is Greek salad with gyro, Greek salad with chicken skewer, and the steak souvlaki. Everything has always been outstanding. Salad is fresh, pita bread is killer, tzatziki sauce is great. Service is always friendly and pretty fast. Dining room is clean and nice atmosphere. It's our go-to for Greek in Vegas!

Came here for lunch. Staff was super friendly and helpful with the menu. The decor was very modern and fresh looking. The restaurant was set up fast food style where you order your food at the register and it is brought to you. Don't let that fool you the food isn't fast food style but gourmet Greek food. The gyro and steak souvalki was very good full of flavor. I love that they have a kids meals here not only with the traditional chicken nuggets but actually Greek food made smaller for kids. My children loved the kids chicken souvlaki and they offer it with soda or a juice box.  

You have to have to order the feta frys. I've never had anything like it feta and and another type of cheese with more Greek seasoning on it so good I could not stop eating it!!

Stopped in for lunch... it has a nice, fresh look to it. 
I ordered the mezze plate, my husband got the greek salad with a steak skewer. 
The mezze plate was good. The spanakopita was huge. The grape leaves had a great taste along with the tzaziki. The hummus was ok. I wish they had falafel on the plate too. 
  My husband said his salad and steak skewer were good. The salad (small) was huge. He could not finish it. This is a great spot for a fresh meal on a road of fast food.
Good food, quick service, nice size plate of food for the price. I'd recommend it to anyone in the area for a quick healthy bite.

Excellent Greek food, full of flavor. Downside was it was kind of pricey, and the lamb gyro was not very good because the meat was too soft so the texture was all the same. Would definitely come again if I'm in Vegas.
Amazing food everything tastes great! The burger is always picture perfect if you want french fries get the Greek feta fries! They are amazing

Good food and good service.
My husband and I came here for lunch and it was pretty good. We came around 11:30am and it was just before the lunch rush. The ambience is very modern and casual. I ordered the Grill Chicken Kabob and my husband got the gyro plate. Both selections were very yummy and their fries and yogurt sauce is on point! The service was great, as well. We got our food less than 10mins of ordering it and the staff checked up on us frequently. We will definitely come back in the near future.

The Great Greek is super delicious and well priced!! I recommend getting the avgolemono soup which is a creamy, lemon, chicken soup! For 3.75 a bowl you can't beat it, even comes with complimentary pita bread. I also tried their great Greek gyro which had tender meat, a well flavored tzatziki, and a generous amount of feta. Lastly, my boyfriend tried their steak souvlaki plate that came with rice and a side salad. He said his steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked.

*** Bottom Line: The Great Greek provides well flavored food, good-sized portions, friendly service, and fair prices!

I wanted to get some Greek food for lunch and found this place. I got a chicken gyro and salad. It was really good. The pita was so soft and I'm glad I didn't ask for extra feta because finally a place that puts on the proper amount!  I will definitely go here again!

A fly in my food.  How gross. I payed $45 for take out and when we get home there was a dead fly in my wife's salad. 
Did not even want to take it back as we we live in Southrrn Highlands and the girl behind the counter was extremely rude anyways so it's just not worth it.  Clean up please!!
We took a loss but will never go back.
Amazing gyros! The feta fries were delicious as well! My daughter loves the chicken fingers and fries. And I love that it tastes like real chicken!

By far one of the best Greek restaurants in town. 

The food! This location off blue diamond is always spot on with their gyro meat. Juicy, perfect spice blend, and generous in portions. I recommend the Gyro Plate with rice pilaf or Great Greek Gyro with feta fries if you're feeling indulgent! Haven't tried the baklava yet, but have heard amazing things about it.

Service has been top notch every time, with speedy serve times and plenty of staff to handle lines. It is an order at counter style eatery, so no table service. However, the effort that goes into the food and service deserves a gratuitous thank you. Treat them well and your tummies will thank you for a Great Greek time!

3.5 STARS 

Friendly service. Love the rustic industrial ambience. We ordered the great Greek gyro, feta fries, Athenian burger & hummus.

Greek lamb gyro A+ says my husband 
Feta fries C
Athenian burger B
Hummus A+

I gave the fries a low grade because it tastes like the fries were old & fried again. 
The Athenian burger was good but not the best. 
The hummus with pita bread was excellent.
My husband loved the gyro.
I try something new every time I go! Their Gyros and Falafel are my favorite!! Must try!! So good!

I fell in love with this restaurant when going to their Henderson location. Then they opened the Blue Diamond location and I have to say it's not a good representation of this company at all. The food is still good but the service.. Jesus! The girls in the front are either overworked to the point where they don't remember to smile OR they really don't smile! There's one that I try to avoid at all cost when I go. I am a regular customer and by "regular", I mean I purchase food from here 3 times a week at least. However, I will NOT go when that girl is there. Which is hard because I think she's part of the owners family or something? She's unprofessional, rude AND unorganized. I heard her tell the kitchen staff "If you have something to say, you can work somewhere else" while I was eating today. I was shocked and that was the last straw. I will not eat at this location anymore. If I ever want their food I'll make the 15 mile trip to Henderson just to avoid this chick..

New restaurant in Southern Highlands, which Southern Highlands greatly needs more of. The food is fresh, good portions, and lots of options. However, I'm not sure why but the food just doesn't stand out compared to my other favorite greek spots. Everything was just, okay ... not wow. Good ambiance and service though, food just mediocre.

Been here twice and the delicious food is always on point! Be prepared to have an appetizer, entree and dessert! An Authentic Greek Grill 

Congratulations, to the owners with a beautiful restaurant and a prime location. Way to hype up the SW Las Vegas area!

Very nice Greek restaurant on Blue Diamond and Decatur. Near Fruits & Roots and Capriotti Sandwich.
They have a nice size patio and parking lot.
The restaurant itself is very spacious and clean! The menu offers many option "sandwich for smaller portion" or plates if you are very hungry!
We ordered 1 Gyro plate and 1 Chicken plate. It comes with choice of rice or fries and a yummy side salad (baby romaine, red onions, feta cheese, tasty tomato & olives)
It cost about $42 including 2 fountain drinks and 2 rice pudding
Our order was brought to our table.
The chicken was juicy and tender. The gyro meat was very good and nicely flavored.
Very happy to have another great Greek in SW!!
I like that they had some Franks Hot sauce, Sriracha & Tapatio available
This is a yummy place. We have gone to their location many times in henderson. Glad there is one closer to our house now. :)
This place is always great.  Exceptional food with a culture of great customer service.
Food is generally pretty good but not exactly worth the prices. The service is decent and I have never had any issues with staff.

Definitely glad this placed open near me! There were no Greek places nearby when I would want to just go grab Greek food. I love Greek food and this place did not disappoint. I got a traditional lamb gyro as well as the the feta fries. That was a great deal of food that I could not finish but worth the price for delicious food. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some great quality food!

So good! I was very happy with the service and the food, you can tell everything was prepared fresh and in house from high quality ingredients. I will make sure to add this in the rotation for a fast casual meal.
Ordered the great geek gyro with lamb & beef, and a side of pita bread with hummus. It was absolutely delicious and was delivered in a timely manner. I will definitely be ordering more often.

So I'm a little confused by this place. It took 30 min to make two gero's to go. We ordered next door a Capriottis and from this place. Within 5 min, the sandwiches were ready. 30 min to shave some already cooked meat and put on a pita? Capriottis had to cook their meat and it was done within minutes. If the food was extraordinary then I would understand it would be worth it but.... it's not. 

Good luck, if you keep this up.

Was really excited to have a Greek place close to home but after trying was a little disappointed. Ordered the Rice Bowl. Not sure why they called it that considering there was barely any rice yet there was a lot of greens which was fresh but it drowned out the rice and you couldn't even tell if the rice had any good flavor. Had the steak with the rice bowl and asked for medium but instead got way well done not to mention it was so little meat it really wasn't even worth adding to all the greens and barely any rice. I also added the Mezze Plate so I could try a few of my favorite Greek items. The Spanakopita was the best I've ever had, the Dolmades were really tiny and had no flavor, the Falafels were really dark brown which I can assume was way over cooked, the Tzatziki sauce was watery, and the Hummus was extremely lemony. I love lemon but not as the main taste in my hummus. I guess I won't be having Greek food so close to home after all because I won't be going back anytime soon.

Ive been here three times and the food is exceptional. If you have never had a gyro that you cared for you need to try one more time at the Greek. 
All the meats are done to perfection on their grill. The steak and lamb are moist and tender.
Crowded at lunch time, but there is a reason for that.
Really really good food. The place is clean, the food is fresh, the service is fast. It's nice to have more food options in the Southwest of Vegas.

As far as I am concerned this place is tied with Milos at the Cosmopolitan as far as taste, authenticity and freshness. I am always willing to make the trek to Henderson so my pleasure that there is one in the SW can't be measured.  If you love Greek food - do not sleep on The Great Greek.

This is my favorite Greek spot to go to for lunch or dinner!! I've been looking for years in Las Vegas of a good spot and I swear this is it! And it's conveniently close! I think their food is so fresh, and my favorite is their shrimp & rice  I come here about 1x a week if not more.

I am so excited that a The Great Greek location has opened closer to my house in the SW. The food is delicious and the customer service is excellent. One of my favorite places to eat and I cannot wait to become a regular again!

The staff was not friendly. Nobody smiling at all. It's like they could care less if your there. 
Gyro meat was very good 
Fries were half cooked and mushy. 
Probably won't be back mainly because I did not feel welcomed.

very average.  I got a gyro sandwich.  the meat was overdone.  lettuce was starting to wilt.  there was very little tzatziki sauce.  when I asked for additional sauce I was charged $1.00.  told her it was light on sauce.  still charged me.   nothing more annoying than feeling like they are trying to get every last cent from you.

The freakin best.  Those feta fries... lord have mercy!!! Must try.  The gyro meat is very good as well, flavorful and tender.  I'd prefer crispier but that's minor.  The gyro plate is very filling,  loved the salad and rice and pita with the meat.

We've eaten here once a week if not more since they opened. Food is is fresh, fast and taste amazing. Love how they ask you want your steak. The usual is the great gyro and a steak plate and a small side of hummus....and the FETA FRIES!! Those are a must try. You can also do a mixed plate... I do steak and shrimp sometimes. Only reason they didn't get 5 stars is they messed up on my to-go order, nothing big just forgot my small side of hummus but was refunded for it.  Put it this way, I don't review anything but I just want people to know how great this place is!

Great food! So happy it's close to my house. Great pita bread and hummus they will give u more if your sitting down to eat but make sure if your ordering to go you order extra pita bread they do not give enough.  Tomatoes in salad are little big I always cut them smaller. They once Ran out of rice ...... thought that was really weird but substituted fries . Great chicken tenderness and flavor

I was thrilled when I saw they were building this super close to home. Naturally, when it first opened my boyfriend and I visited. The space was a bit smaller and it was super busy. Not complaining tho, I'm sure everyone else wanted to try this place out.

Customer service was good. The staff is super friendly and very professional. 

I would recommend the feta fries! Ugh. To. Die. For! No complaints here! I will def be back.

I was dying to try this location and just like their Warm Springs location this restaurant did not disappoint. The freshness and flavors and service are EXACTLY the same as their other location. Quite impressive!  I have to add the consistency clearly states how well run this business is. My favorite meal is the Original Greek Rice Bowl. The flavors just work so perfectly together. I order it twice a week!.....it's a huge salad consisting of perfectly seasoned rice on the bottom topped with the freshest, flavorful greek salad you'll ever taste. I always get a chicken skewer on top and the chicken is consistently cooked to perfection. Their tzatziki sauce is outstanding too. The food here is always so fresh and flavorful I just keep coming back.  
My only complaint is I wish they'd open a restaurant around the Anthem/Eastern Ave area. PLEASE!!!!

Excellent quick serve Greek food. I ate at their other location in Henderson a couple of times, and I'm super happy to see a Westside location. Their food is excellent, always fresh, and I really like the atmosphere. Best gyro in town. Highly recommended!
My coworkers and I ordered here for lunch. I got the greek bowl with the gyro meat. EXCELLENT! We all were greatly pleased! Only wish they delivered.

Great interior, clean bathrooms, importantly a great lamb gyro.
Awesome lamb burger too!

Delicious Greek food! Tried the gyro and side of rice and loved both however seating is limited. Maybe 12 tables plus a bar like counter. Went here on a weekday evening and took the last table. They do carryout as well!

Went to great greek with a group on Saturday and ordered the chicken Shawarma Salad, the Beef and Lamb Gyro fries hummus and Tatziki. Overall the meal was great and everything seemed awesome. Until night time 3/4 people in our group all had extreme stomach discomfort. We were all sharing food so I can't pin point exactly which dish did this to us but we hadn't eaten anything else the rest of the day so we are guessing it was the food we had.

When I found this place off blue diamond I immediately fell in love! So good I returned 2 nights in a row! And am yet to be disappointed. I got the hummus and pita bread for appetizer and you can tell right away the pita I quality either home-made or locally sourced based on the freshness. Went with the great Greek gyro combo (beef) which comes with a side Greek salad and a drink. The auto was huge portion and the salad was dressed properly (not too much dressing) I also tried the mezze platter for an appetizer that gave you a good variety of Greek finger food and everything was amazing! The second night I got the shrimp plate which was also a hefty portion for the price with amazing flavor start to finish!
I didn't expect the food to be this good. The staff is incredibly friendly! I am definitely going to come back and recommend this place to family and friends!

The Great Greek is everything you would expect from a Greek restaurant: gyros, salads, baklava, you know the drill. The interior is sleek and modern, and the staff were friendly. 

The Great Greek has a perfect location if you live in that part of town, since you literally turn right off of Blue Diamond to access the restaurant, perfect if you're craving greek on the way home from work. Give them a call, order up, and your food will be ready by the time you arrive. 

The food is good, but nothing that will particularly blow you away. The tzatziki was noticeably creamier than other tzatziki sauces I've had in the past. It was an interesting change of textures, but was slightly ruined by the fact that they LAYERED that s*** on my gyro. Unless you're into that, be mindful when ordered and maybe ask for it on the side to control your own destiny. 

Overall, it's nice to have another Greek restaurant, but Stephanos is still the undisputed Greek God when it comes to Greek food. The Great Greek is...good, but I'll have to visit a couple more times and have something magnificent before I would consider it 'Great'.

Food was really good but I watched them handle all the food without gloves.    2 cooks kept wiping their noses.   As foul as foul can get.  Not one person handled food with gloves.  I cancelled my order and left.    Visit at your own peril

Decided to see if things had improved.  We didn't have chicken this time but tried the falafel. They give you a lot but they should for the price.   We were looking fwd to french fries we'd had before that were great, they changed them...the new fries are terrible. .coated with something flaky and greasy. Big let down. Service is good. Wouldn't rush back but it's OK in a pinch.

Really tasty food, friendly staff. Prices seem a little high, especially if you take the salmon option (why is salmon so much more $ than shrimp?). But, excellent falafel, rice bowls are huge, delicious hummus, grilled steak plate was nice, & great pastitsio (this is over 2 trips). The salmon for my rice bowl wasn't cooked quite as much as I like but given it's twice what I can eat in one sitting, I can cook it up a little more when I have the leftovers tomorrow. All in all, very good and we will be back!

I had the Greek salad with gyro meat last week for lunch. It was very fresh and a generous portion. My only complaint is that the meat was soggy. It didn't have any of the nice thinner edges that stay slightly crisp. It was still very tasty. 

Service was okay. We got our order to go and it took a while for the woman at the counter to acknowledge us when we were at the counter. 

Their tzatziki is amazing in both flavor and texture.
bomb bomb bomb!!! portions are huge and the food is delicious!! i'd eat here everyday!

Food was solid, but I think they prioritize Togo orders faster? When I arrived there were two people in line who got their food within 10 minutes of ordering. 5 or so minutes after I ordered they did get 3-4 customers ordering to go who all got their food extremely quick as well. My gyro took almost 30 minutes to get to my table. Not used to waiting that long for Greek food and not the best experience for my first time here.

I had been wanting to try this place for lunch after a coworker's recommendation. Since it's a little over 10 minutes from my office, I decided to try ordering from Grubhub for the first time. Before I placed my order it said "total time will be 30-40 mins". AFTER I placed the order it turned into 90 mins! Yikes! So.. I decided to cancel my Grubhub order and just go to the place directly.

I drive the 10+ minutes, park, and when I walk inside there is a huuuge line and only one person working the counter. I'm waiting for at least 10 minutes which seems silly - why not have at least one more person working the register so they can handle the crowd more? On top of that, the person at the counter was also taking ordering calls so we had to wait for her to finish making the line move even slower. I was almost ready to bail but since I had waited this long (and made the trek), I decided to stay.

When I finally got up to the front, ordering was thankfully fairly smooth. I got my food to go and when I asked, I was told it would be another 15 minutes for it to be ready. I wish the lady behind the counter would have volunteered that information instead of me having to ask after I placed the order. But once again, I'm already committed, so might as well ..
 
Ordering food to-go is kind of weird because they don't give you a number and there's really no where to sit and wait. I didn't want to take up a spot at the table for people dining in since it was already crowded, but I didn't want to stand because it was gonna be at least 15 minutes? So the whole thing just felt weird and clunky. I saw a lot of people get to-go orders so I would have thought they'd have a better process.

After a few minutes, I decided to check on my order, and I found that my original Grubhub order was actually made instead of being cancelled. I panicked because I had just placed an order for the same exact thing. The lady at the register assured me my order had been cancelled and so I wouldn't be charged (even though it was made). At the same time, the order I had placed a few minutes ago came out, so she packaged that. While I thought she would just give me the second cancelled order as a nice gesture since it was already there and ready, she instead put it to the side and had zero interest in offering it to me. This was a huge disappointment as other places happily offer me "mistake orders" all the time. I mean the food wasn't cheap to begin with. But, since I had to get back to work, I didn't want to fight it.

And as for the food? It was just okay, but definitely not worth the hassle. The steak was decent but the lamb was super tough. I got it medium - which the lady recommended - so I don't know if it should have been cooked less or what. I was also REALLY hyped about the feta fries, but when I got them they were way too cheesy. They also didn't taste very feta to me? If you love cheese then you'll be fine, but if you're looking for more crispy fries with feta accents (like other places I've been to), I think you'll be disappointed.

Overall I'm hesitant to recommend this place for lunch. If you do, order ahead or be prepared for a long wait.

Happy to see this business thrive in the Las Vegas community.  Serving great food!  It's quick service, great quality and friendly service.  Restaurants like Me Gusta Tacos and Great Greek coming into the southwest part of the valley are a great thing!  Keep doing your thing great Greek!

Exceptionally good food! Fresh, quality ingredients. The salad is always crisp and flavorful; the meats are lean, tender, and moist. Even the rice pilaf is delicious. So happy that they opened a location in the southwest!

We've visited this location 3 times now and each time the food has been delicious, very clean inside and never a long wait. I can only comment on the salads & skewers because it's the only thing we've tried. But we keeping back for them!!! I can't wait to try some other menu items.
I got the rice bowl with shrimp it was so good. Can't wait to go back and try everything else.

We visited for the first time yesterday (7/13/17) around 4PM prior to the dinner rush.  The restaurant is clean, with a modern/minimalist interior.  We frequent Greek/Mediterranian establishments quite often due to our diets, and this has risen quickly to the upper ranks of our list.

You go to the counter to order, and the food is brought to the table by a runner.  Drinks are self serve.  The tea is fresh brewed, so that's a huge plus.

All of the staff members were super friendly and helpful. 

The menu has a large variety including avgolemono soup, all types of skewers, and even baklava ice cream.  Prices are very reasonable.  An add-on skewer (shrimp, chicken, lamb, beef, salmon) is only $3.75. The kid's menu is fantastic.  They offer gyros and skewers, not just the usual chicken tenders kid's fare.  As someone who has a very restricted diet, I appreciate that I can get skewers separately or a decent kid's plate without a hassle or a weird upcharge.


I got the plated gyro from the kid menu and my husband got the regular gyro plate.  He substituted additional salad for rice at the suggestion of staff.  It has to have been one of the freshest salads I've seen in town.  I don't even like tomatoes, but they looked glorious.  My kid plate was larger than I expected.  I don't know that it would be a full meal for most adults, but it would definitely not fall too short.

The food was fresh, super tasty, and very filling.  The Tzatziki was wonderful. The gyro meat was nicely carved and wasn't overly seasoned.  The pita was not as soft as I would have liked, but not because it was old or stale. I believe it may have been baked just a little too long.

Overall it was a nice experience and very convenient for the SW end of town. I look forward to a return visit to try the skewers and soup.

The wait time here is always ridiculous. The food is good, but not worth the wait. If they tell you it's a 10 minute wait, it's really 20. Today they said 25 minute wait, but I waited 55 minutes! It's Mother's Day, they're busy, I get it. But I asked them before i made my order how long it would take. Don't tell me 20-25 minutes and have me waiting an hour! And he's worse, the girls behind the counter acted like I was inconveniencing them! I would like to leave then a 1 start for rude service and inaccurate wait times, but like I said, the food is good. But I most def won't be back. If I wanted to wait an hour, I would go to a sit down restaurant
Was decent. Not 100% authentic but it's close. Will try again. Wasn't too impressed. My friend loves it. Will b back

This place was so cute! Walked in and was greeted very warmly by staff. It was pretty packed inside so I knew I was in for a treat! The guy at the counter was super friendly too and even gave us a couple suggestions since it was our first time there. 

Like I said, they were pretty busy when we came in so I can understand waiting a little longer than usual but when I got my food, which I took to go, it was cold and the pita bread was a little hard. 
Regardless, the food was still delicious and very flavorful. I ordered the chicken skewer which I highly recommend along with the feta fries! Yum! 
Another disappointment was that they forgot to include the side of hummus in my order :( 
I was super disappointed since I was really looking forward to trying it. Oh well ! 

The food was delicious but I really wish it wasn't cold when I ate it and I wish I got to try the hummus. I gave this place 3 stars but I want to give it another shot and maybe dine in next time! Will definitely update this review!!
Great place for a casual lunch! We got the gyro plate with the feta fries. The feta fries were amazing!

Amazing customer service!

Looking for a place to eat and chitchat with a dear friend, we happened upon the Great Greek.  She had her one-year-old with her so we wanted to find some place appropriate, accommodating, and with indoor seating.  It was quite packed when we got there, with no seats left inside (only tall counter area left, which is kind of difficult to manage with a one-year-old).  Before we walked out, one of the servers / food runners saw us and told us to hold on because a couple tables were getting ready to leave soon.  He told us that he'd clean it up right away and get us a highchair, too.  I thought it was amazing that he even spotted us in the midst of all the food running and the fact that it was quite busy.  It's not a waiter-type of restaurant; it's the order-at-the-counter-and-get-a-table-tent-number-type of restaurant, but still.  

The food was just as good.

The hummus was absolutely delicious.  Not the overly fancy kind where they try to throw everything but the kitchen sink in it.  Just straight up good hummus.  

The gyro was rather large, which was great because I was super hungry.  I enjoyed it.  The vegetables were fresh and the meat was tender and flavorful.  

The baklava was good, but different.  Kind of tasted like cereal, granola, and really tasty honey.

Overall, I really liked this place.  It's a cute, casual spot that's great for catching up with friends or grabbing a bite with family.  Nice, friendly, and helpful staff.  Would recommend and would definitely go back.

Well, this was a surprise!

The husband and I were craving Greek food and he remembered seeing this place "coming soon" not too far from the house. We swung by tonight and, in all honesty, I was expecting decent grub and a so-so atmosphere. It was far better than that.

The place itself is very nicely put together, especially considering it falls under the "fast casual" umbrella. Beautiful wood on the walls, lots of planters, nice lighting, lovely tables all with vases and fresh flowers. It was very inviting. Also, food is served on real plates with real silverware and the plates have a kind of pottery look and feel to them which adds to the overall effect.

But more importantly - the food!

We ordered two gyro combos; my husband's had feta mine didn't. Both were the lamb/beef combo with juicy fresh tomatoes, red onion, deliciously fluffy and thick tzatziki sauce, and a scrumptiously fluffy pita to hold it all together. Guys, it was phenomenal! Meat was tender and delicious, veggies were on point, and the sauce was addictive.

I had rice pilaf as a side (yummy!) and the hubs had the feta fries. The feta fries were a revelation. Perfect spuds with feta and tons of oregano mixed throughout (I hate it when there's only cheese on top!) and cooked together into a creamy, gooey, crispy, unctuous mass of magic. I stole many of his fries and husband is a good man because he let me. 

We also got some eggplant dip as an appetizer and it was very good. All good was ordered at the counter but brought to your table. Service was wonderful, extremely friendly and genuine.

I short, I'd go back in a heartbeat. The only problem is deciding whether to eat that amazing gyro again or try something else because the whole menu looks awesome.

Best Greek spot in town, hands down! The food never disappoints and I'm speaking for both this and the original location in Henderson. Their salads have so much flavor, the gyros are crave worthy, the feta fries. Yeah, I'm gonna just leave that there. 

My girlfriend and I usually get the souvlaki (chicken, steak and/or lamb) plate and it is so satisfying, and for the price, you really can't beat it. The staff are also very friendly and efficient. If you don't like to wait, I suggest you call in your order for takeout as it usually takes about 10-15 mins for them to have your food ready. Hey? At least you know it's fresh! But personally, I think it's well worth the wait. Enjoy!

This place is decent but nothing to go out of your way for. I tend to go due to its location.  

The service is super slow and they seem to be a bit unorganized, im sitting here now waiting 15min for a gyro.  If your in the mood for greek and just happen to be in the area its ok but i think there are much better options with better service.

Ive changed to 2 stars as im gettimg close to 30min wait for a f'in gyro!!

From now on I will take extra time to drive to rainbow where there is a much bettet greek spot!

Terrible first experience. How do you run out of rice? I mean I guess it happens but you should really be prepared if you are running a business. I'm Asian so I need my rice or I won't be satisfied. Ugh, waited 30+ mins for it. So annoying when you are starving. Their food is ok. Not bad but but nothing special.

This is a great little neighborhood Greek spot. We went in mid-week around 8 p.m. and the place was clean and the customer service was fantastic. We were recommended to try the feta fries (amazing) and we ordered a gyro plate and a grilled shrimp skewer plate. Both came with a really fresh Greek salad and rice pilaf, which was also quite good.  Portion sizes were huge (we had enough for dinner and lunch the next day). My husband really liked the gyro, he only wished that they had put it on the flatgrill for a couple of minutes to crispen it up just a bit. My shrimp was flavorful and not overcooked and the plate came with 2 large skewers of shrimp. We will definately be back!

Nice, clean place with friendly staff. Food is your typical Americanized Greek food. I suggest if you can't tell the difference than I would give it a shot. Decent portion but more on the expensive side.
Super nice staff and amazing food. Seasoned just right and presentation was awesome. Appetizer was so good it DIDDNT stand a photo.

I wasn't overly happy to be dining here, as I'm a vegetarian, and most Greek places don't offer a lot, other than a Greek salad which I can make at home. Alas, my friend was set on coming to this place, and worst case scenario, I could go next door to Capriotti's. 

That being said, I ended up ordering fries with feta and tzatziki sauce on top, and they were DELICIOUS!! However, not something I can order regularly unless I want to gain a hundred pounds lol. The tzatziki sauce was so incredibly good, I took a few bucks back up to the cashier to order another side of it, and she just gave me another side, free of charge. Staff was super friendly, and restroom and dining area were clean. This is close to my house and would really like to dine here again and try something different! Oh, he loved his gyro that he ordered, also.
Love! Love! Love! I cant get enough of this place.  I really love the feta gyro!  The service is quick too which makes it nice when in a hurry
My favorite Greek quick food option and now it's on south west side of town at Decatur and Blue Diamond.  Can't go wrong ever with chicken kabobs or the gyro plate. Delicious
Love The Great Greek and beyond excited to now have it in the SW on Blue Diamond and Decatur. The food is always so very fresh so you can't go wrong with anything  here! The decor is also very nice.

The Greek food here is so good and smooth. The steak for the pitas melts in your mouth . It is so great. The lobby is very welcoming and inviting. Our cashier brought us our food and continued to make sure our food was delicious and we were comfortable. Which we were

Had the Lamb Skewer Plate with feta fries, and my bf had the traditional gyro plate. It was alllll delicious. Plates came with a salad (yummy), pita & hummus (yummy). Everything was awesome and the feta fries were freaking fantastic!! Coming back for just those in general. And, the service was great. A woman served us and she was so incredibly nice and explained the menu to me!!
Always fresh, juicy chicken with excellent rice pilaf and a salad that's PERFECTLY dressed every damn time!!! If you don't like this place, you are not from this planet.

Very very good, and great that it's so close to home. The southwest has needed more Greek options and this is a great one! Got a traditional gyro- gyro meat was good, tzatziki sauce good, and my stomach will leave happy! 12 dollars for the pita, fries, and a soda which is pretty average. Can't wait to come back and try more on the menu!

I really like this place. 2 times in the last 5 days good. I have had the steak traditional plate w/ feta/mozzarella fries(omg best fries I think I have ever had), side greek salad. Yesterday I had the small greek salad w/ chicken and steak skewer and a side of feta/mozzarella fries. I love Stephanos but, Great Greek has just been put on my radar. I stayed away for the first few weeks due to the reviews. Well either they just had some opening pains or people are morons. Either way "Great Greek Fam" amazing job and I love how hard you all work to make this place somewhere we can grab something not so unhealthy other than the feta fries but, omg I can't those fries are so dang good keep it up!

We drive by the place a lot and we finally made it in for the first time. There was a line when we walked in and the dining room was almost full which was a good sign. It also gave us a chance to look at the menu as well as see entrees being brought out to the tables. We placed our order and about 10 minutes later one of the girls came to our table telling us that it was going to be a 30 minute wait for rice and asked if we wanted to wait or get a different side but we went ahead and decided to wait since we wanted to have rice with the meat. It really did take 30 minutes for the rice to cook. Then we noticed them starting to serve plates with rice and other tables that had been there way after us we're getting their food first. My husband had to go tot the counter and talk to someone and let them know we were there way before these other customers and the girl told him that they just start putting rice on all the plates but not in the order that they were placed. We finally got our food and fortunately it was very good. It was disappointing that they would run out of rice on a busy Saturday during lunch causing us to have to have a long wait for our food. After this experience we don't know if we will come back or even recommend the place to our family and friends.

Delicious.  I called up and placed an order to go.  2 gyros.  Perfectly delicious.  Only next time I will order tziki on the side, as it wasn't evenly distributed, but who cares cause the food was great.  Growing up in NYC and lots of gyros, I was very happy when hubby brought it home. Since first posting, we have been there over 12 times.  Three of those times we brought other guests, a few of them from out of town.  I just recommended them  Saturday night to a friend who lives in the neighborhood who didn't even know it existed.  They went yesterday (Sunday) for lunch and loved it.  I think they have a new customer who will be back. Reminds me of a greek fast food place back in my home town of Bayside, NY.

I didn't know what to expect walking into the Great Greek. I was hungry and had heard good things, so I decided to check it out. It is a fast food Greek restaurant. The interior was clean and orderly, even though they were at the tail end of a busy lunch rush.

You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table. The staff are helpful and will help you figure out the menu.

I tried the beef/lamb Great Greek Gyro, with a salad on the side. They also offer the Gyro with chicken.The Gyro was a little heavy on sauce, but the flavors were good. The tomatoes and onions were fresh and popping with flavor.

The salad was crisp and refreshing. Watch out, the kalamata olives still have pits in them.

The staff collected our dishes as soon as we finished, they were definitely on top of their game. Impressive for such a new restaurant.

This was a quick and easy meal that tasted pretty darn good. I'll be back!

The reason I give them 2 stars is just because of the food . I ate there few times , the food was always fresh , the chicken was great .. 
too bad that the employees made my last visit my last one . The Mexicans in the back kitchen thought because I'm white I can't understand Spanish ..while I'm waiting for my food I hear them laughing at the customers that coming in including myself , saying stuff like "why this niggers come here ? They should go to McDonald's " "now this old couple gonna take forever to finish eating " etc... 
I don't know if they were mad because people came like 5 minutes before closing but they were just unbelievably disrespectful .. I'm not the one who will anything to them .. I just took my food , threw it to the trash outside and left the place . 
Never coming back there again . 
The owner should definitely fire the back stuff !
Love love love this place.  Great portions and very consistent!!  So nice having a place of quality near Mtns Edge!  My husband usually is not a fan of Greek food but he loves this place!
This place is fantastic....so fresh and tasty.  Love this place and the staff is always on it.  Great menu.  Whats not to like about the Great Greek.

This has become my go-to place for Greek food.

Fresh, fast, large portions. I always get the KIDS size because once I got the regular portion and I had enough for 2 meals (which is not a bad thing). I have gotten the Gyro sandwich and platter from the Kid's menu with the salad and fries as sides. I have also tried their lemon chicken soup, which I think would be wonderful when you are feeling sick. Don't forget to get the Greek cookie to finish your meal! They are yummy! I have only taken my meal to-go but the restaurant is clean with a very nice design. You order at the counter and they bring out your food. They also clear your plates when you are done. Overall, I highly recommend them. I look forward to trying something new on their menu the next time I visit!
We have eaten here several times and never been disappointed!! The food is awesome and the place is clean. Highly Recommend place

I am giving this place a 1 star because of the customer service . As soon as we walked in the door at 8:50 we were told .. ohh we close at 9 by the way . Not a hello, welcome nothing . So basically she told us we couldn't stay and eat that we had to take it to go . It was so uncomfortable that the couple next to us was sitting down eating and they got up and left and the lady cleaning the table said oh you can stay and they still got up and left . About 5 min later a group of 8 people walked in and they told them the same thing I can take your order but you can't stay . I will never be back because of the horrible service .
Best Greek food I've had out here in Vegas! The staff that work there are very nice and my food came out fresh and hot!
My falafel rice bowl had no rice, no dressing, no tomato, no garbanzo beans.  I came in today around 2:30 for a takeout order and didn't realize until I was at work and could not return.  :(
Living in the southwest, it's really hard to find a good greek gyro place. I'm from Chicago and the gyro here reminded me of back home. Friendly staff and great customer service.
My favorite Greek restaurant in Vegas. Great service and great food! Never had a bad meal here.
Great place to dine for lunch or dinner. Our meals were made fresh, using fresh vegetables, well seasoned meats and fresh pita. Overall, we had a delicious dinner and look forward to coming back.

Went for dinner. I ordered take out ahead as I  wasn't sure if it was fast casual or more sit down. It is fast casual, order at counter and they bring to the table. Food was ready b4 I got there so quick. We got 2 gyros. One with lamb and one with the gyro beef/lamb meat. The lamb was very good; tender and juicy and seasoned well absolutely perfect.  The gyro meat on the other also tasted good. We also got the 4 dip app. It is huge, 3 types of hummus and a yogurt dipping sauce. Lots of pita bread. Also get the feta fries,  delish.
So happy to have a new restaurant in the area that isn't fast food. The chicken gyros here are amazing. Nicely seasoned and juicy.

Just had the Great Greek cater our get together. They delivered on time. Ordered a half tray of chicken Giro kit and a half tray beef/lamb Giro kit, a half tray rice pilaf and a half tray greek sald. It was so much food, enough to feed at least 25 people. We only had 10, but I have The Great greek for the rest of the week and we're not complaining. Everything was perfect, just like eating at the restaurant. We will definitely be ordering again and again, just a bit less since it was so much food. The prices are very reasonable. I recomend them catering any event you're having.
Outstanding quality of food at a very reasonable price. Everything we tried was excellent. Very quick and courteous service. I highly recommend this place.

I love the food here. However, the growing popularity makes your service lack. You can see the bustle on the faces of both front line staff and cooks. A bit of suggestion to maintain the flow. If you know your kitchen is behind why not slow it down by just having one person ring in transactions on one register. The rest can do what they were doing which is one busing and the other running food. The guy at the register should not bounce back and forth between the two registers, you made the wait time horrendous. Especially since people who walked in 5 minutes behind me got their transaction and food before me. I truly hope you guys sort out a game plan on how to handle the business before the food becomes sub-par cause of lack of attention to quality and poor customer service.

Yesterday around 6:30 we ordered dinner for 4 people through Eat24. While ordering we weren't to clear about some of the items on the menu. No big deal. We just decided to call to get clarification. We called three separate times:
1st time: we just wanted to know about their combos. When the call was answered we were asked if we cold be placed in hold. The wait time wasn't long at all but the woman at the other end of the phone was EXTREMELY rude and hung up on us before we could ask all of our questions. We only had two.... 

2nd time: same thing.

3rd time: our order arrived between 45-60 min after we pressed, which was expected but our order was incorrect. When we called back the same woman from the first two called answered and continued to be very rude. And again hung up.We just wanted to let them know that what we presented was not prepared how we ordered it.  

All though our order was incorrect, it was very good. There's no question that they have good food. The reason for two stars is because of the customer service we received. I'm not usually one to leave reviews. But I think they may need to look at how they treat customers who call their establishment. That experience alone is enough to not make me want to order there again regardless of how good the food is. Customer service is key!!
