Food was wonderful we had the great Greek gyro and great Greek salad and the rice pudding was perfect. Will definitely be coming back.

So thrilled a Greek place opened nearby. The food is fresh, no frills, and delicious. 

This is my second time in and it's still very good. I love consistency! The service was also faster this time (came on a Sunday holiday weekend evening). 

Also checked out the bathroom this visit and it's clean.
 
Love this place!

This place is great. The food is always fresh.  Sorry I ate everything and forgot to take pictures.  The staff is friendly.  And they are efficient and fast.  The fresh hummus is super yummy.  My favorite dish is the garlic shrimp plate! So yummy! I highly recommend this place. The price is right!!

Just as awesome as the original location in Henderson, The Great Greek is a solid addition to this side of town. I ordered at the counter and the food was brought out to my table in less than 5 minutes. I'm a fan of the fast casual restaurant format, especially for this type of menu. Much faster than a sit-down casual format. 

I ordered the Great Greek Gyro and made it a combo, adding a drink and rice pilaf. My gyro was filled to the brim with meat and was happily stuffed at the end of my meal. Since it's so close to home, this will be my go-to Greek restaurant going forward.

Tonight was my first time at the Great Greek!  All I can say is WOW!!!  I was immediately impressed with how clean and sleek the restaurant looked.  You know when a restaurant goes through the effort of putting fresh flowers on the table, that they care about freshness.  Now onto the food, absolutely unbelievable!  We had hummus as an appetizer, then both my husband and I order traditional gyro's where he had rice pilaf and I had feta fries.   This food was spot on and the pita was so fresh you could tell it was right out of the oven.   And the lamb was incredible! The staff was quick and friendly,  I loved everything about it.   I will be back!  My new go to for Greek food!   Love love love!
One of my favorite Greek spots to go! Food is always Delicious and great service is provided weather donning in picking up or delivered.

BS +++

Holy Greek.  I am very fond of good grilled food.  As soon as I saw this place I was curious.  I've been eating lots of fried foods and I want to see what the buzz was all about.  Holy yum. Me and my wife had the salmon salad, grape leaf wraps, and I got the chicken gyro.  The portions was just right and the meat was cooked to perfection.  The prices here are super good and the wait staff was friendly.  If you're a vegetarian or a omnivore like myself this place has all the right choices.  I'm a foodie from NYC and trust me this is authentic Greek food.  


* Boomsauce scale.
BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended.
BS = it's just O.K. (experience)
BS+ = Yo! I like this place.
BS++= That's Whoa! This place good.
BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

Two stars for their bomb ass sauce! But oh man! What to start with... 
The girl that was helping us out was really nice and knowledgeable with the menu. My main complain is the bowl itself. For almost $12, you get a SMALL skewer of DRY chicken, rice & the cucumber and veggies. So basically, the whole bowl is 80% rice 15% veggies and 5% meat. The chicken was very dry and was hard to eat. Although once the sauce has been added, it's good. Overall, wouldn't go back to this place. Too pricey for the quality of food

After our long flight to Las Vegas, we are not usually interested in large sit down meal, so once again we settled on dining at this fast casual restaurant.  This time we ordered their eponymous gyro (beef+lamb, lettuce, red onion, feta and tzatziki) and requested extra tzatziki sauce which involved a nominal up charge and not really necessary.  The gyros were delicious and very filling though we left nary a slice of lettuce on our plates.

I can't believe some of the sub par ratings here. Service was amazing! I just ordered take out but they gave me water while I waited and extra to-go supplies so I could bring some for lunch tomorrow. Food was super good. This is fast casual people! I'd say it's like Pei Wei for Mediterranean.

Excellent food. I took a group of friends (14) there this past week. All agreed the food was hot and delicious. There are large portions. This is a walk up but you are served almost immediately at your table and the food is hot, cooked to order. I have to keep saying that it's hot because so many fast food locations give you "almost" warm food.  My lamb was cooked perfectly. Others said the beef was excellent. Gyros were huge! The salads were fresh and the employees were friendly and helpful.

Not sure why this place is currently 3.5 stars! This is my new go-to fresh restaurant. The first time I came I loved their juicy gyro plate and today I had a large Greek salad with the falafel and a side of hummus. The presentation of the plates makes your mouth water before you even start! Everything looks fresh. The falafel are better than Crazy Pita and the salad was crispy and not overly dressed. Any time I want a fresh, healthy meal and I don't want to cook, I'm coming here. Oh, and my dining companion pointed out the plates and silverware are all machine washable, so they are helping the environment, too!

Good food but too many times we have missing items from our order! So frustrating! So we either have to go without sauces or humus ect... or go back at a later time for refund. What a hassle! A small family owned business should have better QC than this! Honestly we've just stop ordering from here.

This was the worst experience all around. Waited an hour for 2 small crappy salads with under cooked poor quality chicken. I must be glutton for punishment because although this is the last time I come in it's not the first time it's happened. Save yourself the hassle if your in the area and go to capriottis next door. I wish I could give negative stars but one will do.

Trying out a new Greek restaurant! We ordered a beef/lamb gyro and a lamb wrap. The gyro was pretty good but I wasn't really a fan on thw wrap. I thought it was ok. I wish they could have add more ingredient to the wrap though such as rice or some more lettuce. All I tasted on my wrap was alot of sauce and lamb.. overall, it was ok for me but my husband loves the gyro that he ordered. The area is very easy to find and the restaurant is pretty spacious. It's not like a togo place.

This restaurant came highly recommended to me, and it is really is a great restaurant. This is our only salad restaurant we have found that is excellent. We have visited many times and always salads with chicken skewers.  I have recommended this restaurant to many friends who have also heard good things about it. Without doubt a second restaurant near Mountains Edge would be a gold mine.
Slow service and incredibly rude customer service too. Person was on their phone the whole time. Never coming back. Don't recommend. Wait time and ugly attitude isn't worth the food.

I absolutely love this place. Been going to this place for years when I lived by their Henderson location. Now that I moved closer to Blue diamond I was really excited to see that they decided to expand! The food is still consistent with the right flavor and portions. I love that this new location is larger. I usually order the chicken gyro with feta fries and my hubby gets the gyro plate which also comes with a salad. The prices are reasonable with the amount and quality of food you get. Great service that is always welcoming. I support these family businesses.

Great first experience here! Large portions, fast, delicious food, clean and bright atmosphere. The bows, gyro plate and chicken dish were all great. The baklava was just ok but we'll definitely return. Great addition to Blue Diamond.

I tried this place for the first time yesterday. It was so good I'm back today for lunch. The lamb gyro is amazing! The owner just came up to me with the sweetest greeting and smile asked me how I like it I told him I'm back today I like it so much. Super friendly vibe. Very clean. Nice staff. I see us visiting here quite often to get our Greek fix.

TBH pretty pricey for the amount of protein you get. For my steak bowl, it was $15 because the upcharge for steak. You only get ONE skewer of meat, which is very little. Your basically getting all salad and rice. I dont think I'll be coming back.

My mom and dad are in town and love Greek food! We were on our way home from Bonnie Springs and saw this restaurant just opened up on Blue Diamond and decided to give it a try. It was packed but the wait wasn't too bad. Very well put together with very cute decor. The kid menu was 7 bucks for whatever you choose to get but the portions are large! Very tasty food and will be coming back again soon!

Any other day this place has a 5 star rating. My family and I have eaten the food here countless times. Until today, we've only had one bad experience. Where our food was overcooked...but today the person taking the order was full of attitude. That I chalked it up to maybe them being busy or her having a bad day.  But when I gave my son his kids plate and plastic film wrap embedded in the food that is not ok. I'm glad I caught
 it before it went into his mouth.  Please be more carful with your food prep I don't care how busy or backed up you get.  Safety should not take a back seat to speedy service.

Food is great! However definitely need to improve on the customer service. I spent $75 on a dinner and asked for 3 extra sauces. The girl at gives me major attitude and says they are extra .95 extra... ok fine... charge my card for an extra $3 for sauce WOW ! You would think that it would be on their menu if they charge for sauce or they would include one with a meal but nope... I'll probably be back but was really disappointed with the lack of customer service. If I could give 1 star for service and 5 for the food I would..

The food here is good and I'm a regular here, but after my last visit I will not be back. I ordered takeout via GrubHub and prepaid for my food and when I came in the service was awful. I waited and waited in line without any acknowledgement from the staff and a woman came in after me and walked right up to the counter to pickup her food they served her immediately and she walked out with her prepaid order. I said to the woman at the counter that I also ordered via GrubHub and had been waiting long before that woman walked in and her response was "hold on." If that wasn't enough for me to not come back, she then sat my bag in front of me on the counter and walked away without saying a word! Smh so rude.

Really fresh veggies and tasty sauces and cheese.   Did take out to avoid trying to find a place inside to sit.... as it turns out it wasn't too busy.  The fries are fabulous.  Crusty and still crunchy 15 minutes later when we got home.   Great Greek gyro is enough for 2 meals!  Again.... so fresh! Tasty tasty tasty

This place is fantastic. I have yet to eat anything that wasn't good. The Chicken Souvlaki and Feta cheese fries are my favorite. The Gyro is a generous size. The lamb is outstanding. My boyfriend get the salmon and loves it. Great food good service and my order is always right when I take out. It always on time. It's my favorite Greak place.

This place is awesome! I love the gyro plate and the baklava ice cream is the best way to end a meal. Service is consistently good and it's perfect for a grab and go on the way home from work. So happy it's opened close to my house!
Great place to eat! The food is really tasty and good portion sizes. One of my favorite places to drop in when I don't feel like cooking dinner.
Now Open!! Was excited to have a Greek place finally on this side of town, this place doesn't disappoint.  Gyros are great with a reasonable price, combos about 12-14$.  I'll be coming back
Great place to pop in for yummy food. Wish they would open one in Summerlin I would be here weekly.

Really enjoyed the food.  Only reason I didn't rate 5 is because the prices were maybe a dollar two more expensive than I'd like to see, and I don't care for the order at the counter option.  

With that said, I definitely will return.  Falafel, dolmades, and salad were all great.

I love this place! They're always busy. I usually call ahead and order takeout. The food is always fresh and delicious. My go to place for a healthy meal when I'm too lazy or tired to cook. 

Portion size is fair and reasonable. They always cook the steak skewers to the correct temperature. I've ordered chicken, shrimp and steak. They always cook the proteins perfectly, it's never dry at all.

The feta fries were the highlight of my family's first time here. I've been to numerous greek/Mediterranean spots and since this place is fairly new and near where we live, we decided to finally give it a try. We ordered the traditional gyro and shrimp and steak kabob plate...it was alright. I tried asking if they have the special garlic sauce, my heart shattered when the gentleman mentioned, "I know Stephano's has it but we don't have that here." I haven't been there (yet!) but I've been to places like Manna and Meraki that carries the super "oh so yummy" garlic sauce that makes the food that much more delicious. For two plates, it was close to $30 which is quite on the pricey side, in my opinion. The place was clean and the traffic was steady on a Sunday afternoon. The workers didn't seem as upbeat as other Greek/Mediterranean places that I've been to. My son enjoyed the pita bread and I guess that's why I gave this place three stars...it was fresh, warm...the way it should be.

I stumbled upon this restaurant when the wife and I were out running errands. I had been craving Greek food for a while and decided to give it a try.....boy am I thankful I did! As soon as we walked in...it was clean and refreshing! The Vegas summer has been kicking our bum...but it was comfortable the moment we walked in the door. The first thing I noticed, was how nice the decor is and how well kept the location is. I was excited to get to the counter. 

Since I hadn't been here before, I stared at the menu in amazement...I feel the young lass at the counter is used to the shock on new faces...so she advised I grab a menu and make myself at home at a table...excellent idea! The wife and I sat down and looked over all of the delicious options.....thankfully she pulled me back...or I would have ordered two of everything! 

Everything sounded beyond appetizing! We decided on a few appetizers, a salad, and some fries, but then I noticed they were offering a special that included a few of the items we were ordering. So we decided to get that and split it. I wanted the greek salad, hummus, and fires....but I was worried that us splitting the meal would leave us hungry.....boy was I wrong!!!!

The ladies behind the front counter continued to bring us parts of our order, as soon as they were ready...and I thought it would never end! I do wish the tomatoes for the salad were cut a tad smaller.....but that's just because I need to be able to shovel the yummy foods in faster! 

Everything we tried was fresh and more than I expected for the prices. Our table was cleaned as soon as we finished each plate, and everyone was beyond kind and helpful. I look forward to making another trip here very soon and highly recommend you do as well!

Honestly was stocked to have this near the house. Heard it opened and been wanting to try it. Asked the Hubby if he wanted to have dinner there this evening only to be disappointed. 

We ordered the traditional Gyro (beef/lamb). It was a HOT mess! Everything was falling apart. The sauce was overpowering and I couldn't taste the flavor of the meat. The meat was cut carelessly. Some where thick, some were thin and some were super thick. The feta fries were very sad. Served "cold" where the feta was just blooped on top. Was difficult to eat as well. 

Ordered a chicken fingers kids meal and it was overpriced. Came with three very small pieces of chicken, fries and salad. 

Place was packed, clean and LOUD!

Would we come back? Nope.
Ordered the steak souvlaki with extra tzatziki, it was so good. Take out was fast and easy too.
This place was so awesome we had a lamb chops special it was the best night ever have had, and I'll be Greek food all over the United States!

Excellent food and service here!  Checked out the restaurant shortly after it opened, and it's a great addition to the southwest part of town!  I come here fairly often, and am always satisfied.

During my last visit, I witnessed a grown man have a meltdown over a pepperoncini, and the staff responded professionally, and calmly despite the comments made towards them.  They work hard to provide a welcoming environment, and they are great at ensuring customers are satisfied.

Cleanliness is always spot on!  Even when busy, they make their way around to clean up the seating area, and pick up your plates when you're done.  I've come here every week since opening, and haven't seen the place a mess yet. The food is also always consistent, and is made perfectly every time.  If something doesn't come out to perfection, they quickly remake it without incident.  

I will continue to frequent this location, and highly recommend this place to others!

This was really great place and food was amazing. The place was very really clean. We ordered several items as take out and all of the dishes were good. The surprize was  the Yia Yia's Pastitsio, it was so flavorful- super yum! I hope to come back again soon.
I have been to The Great Greek a couple of times. Tasty food with nice size portion. Friendly service . Defiantly will go back there again.

My friend took me to lunch here for my birthday! I was craving Greek and had never been here before and she doesn't eat lamb, or onions, or... so this was a gamble on her part as well.  Absolutely terrific, delicious food.  When I ordered the gyros plate I was specific as to what I wanted and got exactly what I ordered and it was DELICIOUS.  Meat was well flavored and tender, the tzatziki was perfect and the pita was exactly the correct mix of soft/crispy that I like.  My friend discussed all her requirements while ordering at the counter and the gracious and helpful server made sure that absolutely everything was perfect before we were served at our table inside.  We were lucky enough to be against the window and watched a tiny boy and his father signing back and forth about his food demands...it would have gone viral if we'd filmed the 2-year old feeding himself the hummus.  So I think we were served immediately but can't be sure. lol.  I will not only go back but I've already been back.  And I ordered the hummus this time.  Great flavor.  Clean, great food, gracious and polite staff, efficient...it's my go to Greek forever.

The food is fresh. The service fair.  Upon ordering and paying i am prompted to, would i like to leave a 15-18-20 % tip.  For what. Standing in line to order my food to go or at best eat there. Get my own water/drink.  I dont think so. The online ordering was a terrible experience. I could not order what i wanted. The site kept showing the wrong quantity. The lid to my salad dressing was not put on tight and leaked all over the bag.

This place is fairly new to the southwest side and I'm glad that they opened to add more cuisine flare to the long Blue Diamond stretch. The food is delicious and portions are fairly large. Customer service was superb. I would definitely recommend this place !
A little pricey but worth the bang for the buck. I love the French Fries. Nice clean place very friendly and great service.

First time here & I have to say... GREAT customer service and amazing food, with a pretty environment. It's like I'm in Greece again! Thank God there's a Greek place nearby! Definitely coming here more!

Can we just talk about how aesthetically pleasing your food looks on their wooden tables as the sun is streaming in. It's absolutely beautiful to a foodie who is obsessed with food porn shots. Have visited this location and twice, and both times did not disappoint, nor did they differ in experience or quality. The staff is extremely friendly and patient to newbs like me, who have absolutely no idea what to order. 

On the first visit I ordered the Gyro Plate with rice pilaf. It seemed a better option and a more bang for your buck kinda thing, but wasn't as yummy as the skewer. Second visit I went with that instead, and was definitely more satisfied. Go with your gut peeps! 

Service was prompt, and location clean. It was definitely yummy!!
Love , Love, Love this place!  Best greek food in town.  Glad they opened on this side of town. Because I usually drive to Henderson to get my greek fix at their original location.
Eat anything on the menu! Delicious! I have visited this place three times in one week! That rice bowl is to die for, it has the perfect rice, salad ratio.

My yo go place for lunch. I used to pass this place every day on my way home. Finally I got to try it and wasn't disappointed. Good is EXCELLENT! I haven't try everything yet but I will. Interior is very nice and clean. Easy to order for pick up, usually ready by the time you get there if you call in advance.

This really is 'Great Greek'. Hubby and I popped in for mid-week dinner to go. I got a grilled chicken gyro with feta fries, he got a grilled chicken plate. Both were really good! The cheese on the feta fries had gotten a little cold by the time we made it home but they were still pretty tasty! We also ordered a side of dolmades, which leads to the -1 star, they were out of dolmades so she offered hummus instead which was priced less than the dolmades. We didn't make a big deal about it because we paid with a card and it would have been more hassle to refund such a small amount so we just ate it. Plus the hummus ended up being good anyway!! Over all I will definitely be visiting again!

This is one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I have tried. The chicken and steak is very moist and tender. If you love lemon soup this is the place. I add a little rice pilaf to it this just perfect for lunch or a light dinner. You can't go wrong

I've eaten here a couple of times now and felt the need to truly express how much I enjoy their food. The food is exceptional! I usually get the skewers, like all the skewers they have and I'm always delightfully satisfied. 

I couldn't think of any other place I'd rather try for catering my daughter's little 4th birthday staycation than The Great Greek. OMG it was AMAZING!

I ordered a half tray chicken
5 skewers of the chicken, steak, pork, and vegetable
Appetizer combo 
And it fed 10 people vegan and non!! Bonus, it was under $150 which was unbelievable!

If you have not tried this place please give it a shot. You will not be disappointed!!

Happy that they opened something different on this side of town.  My fiancé and I tried the traditional Greek beef/lamb gyro and they definitely didn't disappoint.   Get ready to eat with both hands because the Gyros are packed with meat.   Look forward to coming back and trying other things on the menu.
Newly opened closer to us and the food and stuff are still great.  It's bigger than the one on Stephanie but it's not to crowded here which is good for me lol

I love this place for 2 main reasons. First, the food is delicious. I recommend the lamb souvlaki and the Great Greek Bowl with falafel. Their hummus is so creamy and light, I could have it every day. So much flavor with everything, we were pretty much quiet the whole meal bc we didn't want to do anything but eat! Two, the portion size is phenomenal for the price you pay; you definitely get your value/ money's worth. The ambience is cute, fresh and clean and the staff is very friendly. I liked seeing that they enjoyed their job and being there while we were having our meal, it was just a nice extra touch. Outdoor seating is available and the dining room feels like you're eating at your place or a friend's house. Worth a try!

Home run for anyone who loves Greek. We finished a fun day mountain biking and climbing and we're looking for a good, healthy dinner. Fresh, crisp Greek salad, rice plate and Mezze plate was a homerun.

I'm happy to report that this place comes in second best next to the original. I did like the open seating at this restaurant plenty of space for family style dinner. The benefit to this place is definitely being closer to the strip.  I highly recommend the feta fries

I have been to the Blue Diamond location a few times and it has been good almost every time. The steak and chicken souvlaki is amazing and you cannot go wrong with the rice pilaf. The baklava is actually very good and just enough honey. A bit on the sweet side but I prefer that. 

Each plate comes with a salad so no need to order a huge salad is you are ordering many plates.
Excellent,  very very good easy to read menu and reasonably priced. Fast service and lots if parking. They could be a little more friendly but over all 5 stars.

Wow! I'm coming back. By far the best Greek salad I've had in the Valley. If you haven't tried this place you should have a solid case of FOMO. Get in and get some amazing food prepared the right way.

Standard Greek takeout food but with sit-down restaurant wait times to get your food. Staff seems a bit frazzled and confused.

Menu is made up of gyros, casseroles and salads with rice pilaf or fries (the good kind, not garbage Ore-Ida crinkle fries cut like Raisin' Canes.)

Food is pretty standard, tastes like Kronos gyro meat. Prices average about $10 per person. Dining room gets extremely busy at dinner time so maybe order ahead to go to avoid fighting for a table.

Ordered food to go got home had no tzatziki and no pita with my gyro plate.. gotta have some Ziki with gyro meat. I was really excited to try this place and let me down on my first trip. Food is fresh and tasty and salad was really good & fresh with the dressing, but not happy with no ziki sauce, to me that's what I love most about gyro meat it's the combo of ziki and gyro. It's quite a ways from my house also so not traveling back, maybe I'll give it another shot in the future. All in all tasty food 3 stars for the lack of order completion, went to a Greek spot by my house for a side of zeek.

The fiancée and I love Greek food and wanted to make a stop to try out a new Greek place! After walking in we were greeted by friendly people. We ordered two gyros. One was a chicken meal with feta fries (yum) and a beef/lamb gyro with an added steak skewer. After waiting a few minutes our food came out. Instantly we were both surprised by how much tzatiki sauce was on both gyros. Seriously there was a ton! After scraping some of the sauce off we were ready to eat. I went first with my lamb/beef gyro and it was quite tasty. The biggest problem with both gyros was the tzatiki sauce wasn't implanted into every bite! The tzatiki sauce was misplaced and hopefully they can fix that. The chicken we both tried was very dry. The steak skewer was cooked to perfection. Seriously good, but it could have used some salt. Overall I'll be back but ask for lighter tzatiki sauce and hopefully they can put it on the pita bread as well as some on top.

Wow! I was delighted to have sampled the delectable Mediterranean cuisines at The Great Greek. I savored the steak entree and my hubby had the gyro one. Each dish starts off with salad and the fries were so so tasty. I have to say, the hummus here is one of the best I've had. The service was very attentive and the whole restaurant well kept. The portions were very generous and the value for what is served is quite plentiful. If you're craving appetizing Mediterranean fare at a great price, you'll love The Great Greek!
Great place. Great food, ambience is pretty amazing! I have gone to both locations now and I appreciate their consistency throughout the brand.

The Greek bowl here is good. It's basically a Greek salad with rice pilaf, garbanzo beans, a tzatziki dressing, and your choice of meat (I pick gyro) . It runs about $9-10 but it's enough to make two meals out of it and leaves you feeling light and not sluggish like fast food does.
Love having a great Greek restaurant in the neighborhood. Food is always delicious and fresh.

Came here for lunch yesterday. 
First time here. 
Looking for comfort food with a dog friendly atmosphere and ended up here. 

I had the chicken kabob plate with feta fries. It came with a side salad. The wait time wasn't that bad after ordering. 

Dog friendly patio makes me happy. I love bringing my dog wherever I go if possible. 

I would definitely come back and get other things on the menu. 

Parking lot. 
Casual dining. Indoor and outdoor seating.

I'm a fan.

Sooooooo impressed with every single aspect of this beautiful restaurant. First of all, the service here is so genuine, really refreshing decor and the food is amazing. Yes, AMAZING! 

The owners of the restaurant should take pride in the wonderful people working behind the counter. They are so helpful and really know all the dishes that they serve. They go out of their way every single time when it comes to our order to make sure we're satisfied. I just can't say enough great things about the staff here. 

The food is fresh and very flavorful, I don't know where they find such beautiful tomatoes for their salad but these are the real deal! These are not your grocery store variety tomatoes, they really do taste homegrown.

Their hummus and their pita bread are probably some of the best pita and hummus that I have ever had. As a family, we have ordered many dishes here and a lot of crazy to go orders, and they are perfect every single time.

I highly suggest this place for a date, a fun dinner with family, and especially if you're looking to impress coworkers or a boss! My family eats here just about every single week because we love it so much. 
Love, love, love!

I love Greek food and am happy this place opened on this side of town.  Their veggies are crisp, meats are juicy, hummus is on point, rice is tasty.  I tried their soup, yogurt and rice pudding as well.... and wow!  So good!!  It's a place where you walk up, order, pay, sit, then wait for them to serve your order.  Definitely a more delicious and healthier alternative to drive-thrus.
So much food for your buck and the quality is top notch!!! Love everything I've tried! Very authentic!

Nice to have Greek food on this side of town. Build out is very clean n modern. Food was very tasty. I ordered a gyro plate which came with basically an open face gyro sandwich with rice and salad. Portions were ginormous and price was on point. Not expensive for what you get. I could of shared this plate with my husband and it would of been more than enough. Husband had the chicken souvlaki plate, which was 2 large chicken kabobs with rice, salad n pita. I tasted the chicken and it was moist and tasty. We also ordered the hummus. Everything tasted fresh not like some other Greek chains we've eaten at where the food tasted frozen and just heated up.  For 2 meals, 2 drinks and hummus w pita =total was around $35... we went home with tons of leftovers. 
Yes will be ordering food from here in the future.

The food here is great.  I've never been disappointed, customer service is on the other hand a different story..  While I waited for my food I went next door to get a juice, came back and in a couple of mins my food was ready I went to get it and the girl handing it to me threw it on the counter top!  Not sure if she was having a bad day or what, but that is really terrible customer service. Hopefully her day gets better and the customers after me have a better experience.

First time here and have to say we tried the hummus and Greek salad and the food was very good!
The staff was friendly and the manager on duty was very helpful and explained some.items on the menu to us.
The pita bread was fresh and was so good with the hummus.
We enjoyed it so much went back to have hummus again and tried the little fried dough balls that have a Indian spicy taste to them. I can't remember what they are called. They tasted very authentic. 
We are a fan now of this place especially when we are in the mood for a good Greek Salad. It was very good and one was enough to share. I think there is one other location in Vegas for this restaurant and the girl we spoke to thought they maybe opening more soon.
Check it out you won't regret it! Especially if your a hummus fan like us!

It's so good and everybody is SO friendly!!  My husband got the lamb gyro and I got the Greek salad with lamb kabob.  Both were so delicious. We split a lemon soup which was fresh and hot, delicious and light. The food came out quick after that and had plenty of soft warm pita. The Greek cucumber yogurt sauce is the best to dip pita in!!  The half salad is a large portion, so if your a light eater it's perfect as salad doesn't keep well for leftovers. Grab a small baklava or butter cookie for after your meal. Dont wait, they sell out quickly.

Cute place with a fun light-hearted ambiance and decent lunch rush. Nearly identical to Stephano's, almost creepy how similar they are, but Great Greek has a much smaller menu.

Prices are higher, but probably dictated by their lease.

Food was very mediocre. Americanized Gyro offering with average flavor tzatziki. Fries were grossly undercooked, pita was cold and gyro meat was not freshly sliced; it was not even warm.

Probably won't be going back.

Third time I've been here this week with my family- we try something new each time and are never disappointed! Fresh food=light and fresh flavors. Best Greek food I've ever had! The salads are super fresh, proteins are perfectly seasoned and juicy, and the garlic feta fries are out of the world yummy. The prices are also super reasonable. Love this place!

I have been wanting to try this out for a few months. - The food was Excellent, tasty and pretty authentic. Half of my family is Greek so I compare and contrast to Aunts and Grandmothers recipes handed down for generations. I will be going back very soon to try the rest of the menu. I had the Greek Pastitsio and Avgolemeno soup and they gave me a greek salad on the side (may have actually been too much food, even for me). i give the Pastitsio an 8 out of 10 just because NOBODY makes it like my grandmother but this is pretty darn good. - the Avgolemeno soup however I will give a 9.5 - i will say this was one of the best tasting lemon soups with chicken i have ever had. I am extremely impressed. I was so into the food i completely forget to make some food porn images. I will take more when I go back.

Amazing food, fresh, homemade, very clean place and really good customer service! 
We are really pleased to finally have a spot in the neighbourhood that's little different than average American restaurant. Athenian burger was awesome, my kids enjoyed rice bowls, veggie is very nicely cut!
I got the chicken kabob meal. Everything tasted fresh and good...I got two meals out of one. An excellent value!

I stoped by on my way out of Vegas towards LA and wanted to get a healthy salad ... and found this guys on Yelp. Fantastic food .... great service.... lovely staff! Highly recommend this place. The salad was very fresh and the sandwich was delicious. The person behind the cash was very helpfully recommending options to me !

We recieved the recommendation for The Great Greek as we were on the opposite side of the city and we were very glad we went.

For a fast casual, the food was excellent and so was the service. 

We tried the lamb chop special which was great, gyro plate as well as sandwich, the burger, fries, hummus and baklava. 

Everything we had was really good as we share family style and the environment was very comfortable to sit and talk after our meal.

We came her last Sunday, and the women working the register was very abrasive. Not very upbeat and friendly. The food was good but the protein should not be placed on the fries, it makes them soggy. Don't know if I'll return.

My favorite new place in the Southwest. I go at least once a week. The gyro meat is delicious and the portions are very generous. The eggplant dip is my favorite appetizer. I can't say enough about how much I love this place.
I have a Greek food obsession & they definitely are the best in Las Vegas. From the hummus to the fries to the gyro... amazing.

OMG I love this place. So glad they opened closer to me!! I got the lamb/beef gyro and it is so full of meat you can barely hold it with two hands. For dessert we had baklava ice cream. I thought I died and went to heaven, such a great combo of flavors.

Today was not a 3 star rating by any means but I have to average the two visits.  This visit being a 1, maybe a 2, but the first visit a 5.  The food was very good the first visit.  Couldn't wait to get back there.  Today we ordered our lunch at 11 to be ready at Noon.  It was 12:30 by the time we got up to the register.  Our order wasn't ready.  An hour and a half??  (All we ordered was 2 salads and a skewer)  I ordered a chicken skewer to go with mine.  She said they ran out of chicken.  ???  I was adamant when placing the order NO OLIVES.  The cashier repeated no olives when ringing my order.  Guess what I got.  It was nasty and I did my best to sit and pick them out.  Today's visit was ridiculous.

Unfortunately I love eating at this place the food is amazing but this is now the third time i have ordered to go and haven't gotten everything i ordered...first time no tzatziki sauce second time no hummus that I ordered this time no tzatziki sauce or lemon....this is actually pricey food to not get what you ordered....looks like I need to find a new Greek place to go to once a week

Came here for lunch today to grab something somewhat healthy. I like how they have a generous portion of salad even if you get a small salad. I ordered a small salad and a steak skewer. The steak skewer is $3.75 on top of the salad which is $5.95. 

It's nice because if you eat there they will bring your food to you, but since it was my first time ordering the salad I didn't know they were supposed to give you the dressing on the side. If my friend didn't say anything I wouldn't have known, which is why they got a four start instead of a five star. 

The steak was good and they even provide you with naan and tzatziki sauce. Not sure how you spell it. The salad had an abundance of onions and oversized tomatoes which I didn't enjoy. 

Overall, the food was good and the service was average. I'd come back again to try their other items on the menu.
